location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.5575 of 1852 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Malet acknowledges receipt of Kemball's previous letter (ff 182-183) and writes that the Governor in Council regrets Lieutenant Tronson exceeding his authority, but has resolved to let the matter pass. Malet also writes that Kemball's instructions in relation to the incidences of breaches of the Maritime Truce are approved by the Government.
